info.name: User Managemant Backend
info.description:
### **Overall System Description**

The User managemant is a task management platform that facilitates user and admin interactions for managing tasks, user accounts, and authentication. The system is designed to allow both **users** and **admins** to manage and interact with tasks efficiently, offering registration, login, and task-related features.

item.name: Admin portal

request.description:
Allows an admin to log in using their email and password. The endpoint returns an authentication token that must be used in subsequent requests to access secure resources.  
Below is the default Admin Credentials.

This endpoint allows an authenticated admin to retrieve a list of all users in the system. The request must include a valid authentication token in the header for authorization. The response returns a list of users along with their details.

This endpoint allows an authenticated admin to delete a user from the system based on the provided user ID. The request must include a valid authentication token in the header for authorization. The user with the specified ID will be permanently deleted from the system.

This endpoint allows an authenticated admin to update the details of a specific user based on the provided user ID. The request must include a valid authentication token in the header for authorization. The request body should contain the updated details of the user.

item.description: The **Admin Portal** is a secure interface where authenticated administrators can manage user data, update user details, view the user list, and delete users. This portal is designed to facilitate the administration and maintenance of user accounts, ensuring smooth operations for the system. Below is a summary of all the key functionalities available to an admin.

item.name: User portal

request.description: This endpoint allows a new user to register by providing their details, including name, email, password. Upon successful registration, the system will store the userâ€™s information and provide a response confirming the creation of the user.

This endpoint allows a registered user to log in by providing their **email** and **password**. Upon successful authentication, the system will generate and return an authentication token that must be included in the headers of subsequent requests to access secure resources.

This endpoint allows a logged-in user to create a new task. The user must provide the task details (such as the task name, description, and due date) in the request body. This operation creates a new task associated with the authenticated user.

The endpoint allows the authenticated user to retrieve a list of all tasks they have created or are associated with. This endpoint provides a way for users to view and manage their tasks within the system.

item.description: The **User** in the User Management application is provided with essential features to register, log in, and manage their tasks in a secure environment. These functionalities ensure users can access and control their own data, providing a personalized experience.
